data.title: Sydney Harbour Tunnel Cameras
data.meta_description:
Hey guys, I think I went through the speed camera in the Harbour Tunnel this morning! =/

Simple lapse in judgement found me hitting 90kmh in the flat...
data.text:
Tom

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Tom

Drive

New: 2006 BMW 335i M-Sport | Old: 2000 Galant VR4, MY04 STI WRX, 2009 Audi A4 2.7tdi

Sep 23, 2010

#1

Hey guys, I think I went through the speed camera in the Harbour Tunnel this morning! =/

Simple lapse in judgement found me hitting 90kmh in the flat spot at the bottom!

I drive it every single morning, and haven't ever had an issue with speed in there, but this morning I just wasn't really thinking and was cruising along.. Then before I knew it I happened to look down and saw I was doing 90!

Does anyone know where abouts the camera is? Maybe I didn't pass it or something! =/

I was heading city bound down the Gore Hill Fwy towards the Eastern Suburbs

qball

1 AYC Bar

Location

nsw

First Name

David

Drive

1999 White Legnum Type S Cold Spec with Recaros+Sunroof

Sep 24, 2010

#2

I think there is more than one now all along the tunnel

king_panther

Gettin' tanked

Location

New South Wales

First Name

Brad

Drive

2012 VW Caddy 1.6TDI 7-Speed DSG. Still crappy DSG.....

Sep 24, 2010

#3

Does anyone know where abouts the camera is? Maybe I didn't pass it or something!

Serious dude? Unless Dave is right, it's pretty much in the middle of the tunnel. Last time I went through it was still the 1 camera. There's a strip of light shining across the road for the camera to capture the photo. That's where the camera is.

Tom

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Tom

Drive

New: 2006 BMW 335i M-Sport | Old: 2000 Galant VR4, MY04 STI WRX, 2009 Audi A4 2.7tdi

Sep 24, 2010

Thread starter

#4

I went through checking again today and I didn't see any strip of light or any camera things on the roof =/ so it must be really well hidden!

Cameras all the way through? Oh snap! I think I definitely might've got done then =/

I know at one point couple years back the Lane Cove Tunnel had cameras all the way through it, but they were proven very dodgy and were replaced with just the one camera.. Don't know about the Habour Tunnel!

MackTheKnife

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Paul Mc

Drive

'90 MX5 and '01 LR Freelander V6 Softback

Sep 24, 2010

#5

I've been reliably informed there's three in each tunnel, but apparently they rotate which one is active (so people don't get three fines for the one drive). There used to be just the one in a well lit section at the bottom, but that changed when they brought in the infra red camera's.

Fingers crossed for ya dude!

Tom

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Tom

Drive

New: 2006 BMW 335i M-Sport | Old: 2000 Galant VR4, MY04 STI WRX, 2009 Audi A4 2.7tdi

Sep 24, 2010

Thread starter

#6

Hopefully if they did get me, it's for 0-10kmh over and 1 point not 3 haha..

MackTheKnife

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Paul Mc

Drive

'90 MX5 and '01 LR Freelander V6 Softback

Sep 24, 2010

#7

They allow 10% for speedo error for fixed speed cameras in NSW so if you were doing under 88kp/h you're schweet.

Tom

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Tom

Drive

New: 2006 BMW 335i M-Sport | Old: 2000 Galant VR4, MY04 STI WRX, 2009 Audi A4 2.7tdi

Sep 24, 2010

Thread starter

#8

Well when I looked at the speedo it was sitting around the 90kmh, so maybe will get a fine for 3-5kmh!

MackTheKnife

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Paul Mc

Drive

'90 MX5 and '01 LR Freelander V6 Softback

Sep 24, 2010

#9

It'd be nothing up to 88kph and 0-10 for up to 90kph and 10-20 for over 90kph.

They just don't issue fines for those within the 10%. That's a bit of what I learned at a drivers offenders course I did many moons ago to get out of a big speeding fine. The police officer giving the presentation seemed focussed on teaching us how to not get caught.

In my old (well 2008 model) civic I had a digital speedo and a really good cruise control, so I used to set cruise at 86kph for that stretch and had no issues after going through hundreds of times.

The Mobile Speed camera's are a whole different story because they are Macquarie Bank's and they don't give any leeway at all as far as I know.

Tom

Leaving Skid Marks

Location

NSW

First Name

Tom

Drive

New: 2006 BMW 335i M-Sport | Old: 2000 Galant VR4, MY04 STI WRX, 2009 Audi A4 2.7tdi

Sep 24, 2010

Thread starter

#10

Sigh well I hope I'll be okay!

Thanks for your help dude, great weight off my mind!

MackTheKnife

Aaron

Drive

1999 Legnum VR4

Sep 25, 2010

#12

i do 85 to 90 all the time in the harbour tunnel and never ever get fined. however a mate of mine was doing 92 and got a ticket. so im guessing the speed camera's are set to go off anything above 90kph.

cyber_scriber

1 AYC Bar

Location

NSW

First Name

Bruce

Drive

2000 Galant; metallic dark blue; manual; Recaros; Momo steering wheel; and sunroof!

Sep 25, 2010

#13

Don't forget Tom that even though your speedo might be showing 90, your actual speed is likely to be lower than that.

Manufacturers generally build in a bit of a tolerance into the speedo so that it shows higher than actual speed.

king_panther

Gettin' tanked

Location

New South Wales

First Name

Brad

Drive

2012 VW Caddy 1.6TDI 7-Speed DSG. Still crappy DSG.....

Sep 25, 2010

#14

Hey Bruce I actually thought it was mandated by law that the speedos had to register a higher speed than the actual speed?

I can (& most often am) be wrong though!

I didn't know about them putting multiple cameras in the tunnel, & I knew there were multiple cameras in the LCT & didn't know they've gone to 1 now?

I also remember the cameras on the M2 toll plaza are barely functioning either, leaving tons of people to drive through without paying..

king_panther

I also remember the cameras on the M2 toll plaza are barely functioning either, leaving tons of people to drive through without paying..

I'm not sure if it's mandated by law Brad.

My gut feeling is that it's probably more mandated by the fear of the law ie. a law suit when a customer gets a ticket because the speedo under read the actual speed limit!

I read that the new Territory cameras have a 4km/h allowance.

What is this about the Mac Bank running speed cameras???

Victoria

Sep 25, 2010

#18

Hey Bruce I actually thought it was mandated by law that the speedos had to register a higher speed than the actual speed?

I can (& most often am) be wrong though!

The ADR states that speedometers must be within 10% of the actual road speed.

cyber_scriber

1 AYC Bar

Location

NSW

First Name

Bruce

Drive

2000 Galant; metallic dark blue; manual; Recaros; Momo steering wheel; and sunroof!

Sep 25, 2010

#19

What is this about the Mac Bank running speed cameras???

Yes, the millionaire's factory seem to have a genuine interest in road safety - Mac Bank lodged a take over bid of the private company contracted to operating the NSW mobile speed cameras.

In short, Mac Bank knows a money spinner when they see one!
